KSP is weird for an alpha IMO. I've seen released games with more gamebreaking bugs than KSP has from patch to patch. Ya there really isnt much in the way of story content but the game does not really need premade content to be fun (not that I'd object to haveing a story mode to play through)

I hope it might be the reverse. Unhappy investors and shareholders are a disaster. So, next time, they might spend a little more time polishing the game to a proper standard. Big boys don't care about customers, they care about who owns them - but in this case that might work out.

Thats my thought as well - KSP could easily be released as a fully developed game TODAY - including the bugs which are far more tame than some of the megabuck corporation games. AND Squad have said that they will be concentrating on resolving the bugs in the beta coming soon which is even more impressive.

I remember reading in one of the releases that ksp has a large number of testers and pre-release userbase which can go through the new updates and iron out anything game breaking straight off the bat - its surprising that no other commercial game has this sort of thing in place - pretty sure the likes of scott manley et al would find all the bugs in AC:U in the first couple of hours and had gone to ubisoft with a full bug report (I question what the heck their software developers were doing during game test day?!) - Also KSP has an open source bug tracker and this is something I haven't seen outside of open source computer programs - unless I'm corrected - we don't see that sort of thing in a commercial game.
